title: Decay constant - S-35 atoms remaining after 6 wks

content.question: A sample of sulfur-<math alttext="35" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mn>35</mn></math> atoms decays to <math alttext="e to the negative 1 power, which is approximately equal to 37 percent" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><msup><mi>e</mi><mrow><mo>−</mo><mn>1</mn></mrow></msup><mo>≈</mo><mn>37</mn><mi>%</mi></math> of its original number in 126 days. In a sample of 10,000 sulfur-<math alttext="35" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mn>35</mn></math> atoms, approximately how much of the sample is remaining after 6 weeks?

skill.text: 2.B: Calculate or estimate an unknown quantity with units from known quantities, by selecting and following a logical computational pathway.
